JavaApi.Samplers.DictionarySamplers
Interface IDictionarySampler

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConstDictionarySampler, CounterDictionarySampler, CustomDictionarySampler, ExternalConstDictionarySampler, StdDictionarySampler
public interface IDictionarySampler

An interface for a Dictionary Value Sampler, called d-sampler for short, which returns a random value from a dictionary of values. When generating graphs, the labels of these graphs will be chosen using dictionary value samplers.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getRandomLabel()
          Returns a random label value from the dictionary that was supplied in the init() method
 void init(java.lang.String fileName)
          Initializes this instance with the data found in the given file.
 boolean isInitialized()
          Returns true iff the Dictionary Sampler was initialized by invoking one of the init() methods
 

Method Detail

init

void init(java.lang.String fileName)
          throws java.io.IOException
Initializes this instance with the data found in the given file. Invoking this methods will re-initialize any previous invocation of any of the init methods.

Parameters:
fileName - - A file containing the data that this instance will use for returning random values.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - - In case of IO problems while handling the file

Returns true iff the Dictionary Sampler was initialized by invoking one of the init() methods

Returns:
- True iff the Dictionary Sampler was initialized by invoking one of the init() methods

                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Returns a random label value from the dictionary that was supplied in the init() method

Returns:

Throws:
